pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:0.4: The sub-chapter on sunshades and sandals
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:0.5: 95. The training rule on asking questions
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.2: At that time the nuns asked questions of monks who had not given leave.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.3: The monks complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.4: “How can the nuns ask questions of monks who haven’t given leave?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.5: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.8: “… How can nuns ask questions of monks who haven’t given leave?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.9: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:1.11: ‘If a nun asks a question of a monk who has not given leave, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.1.10: if she gets leave to ask about the discourses, but she asks about the Monastic Law or philosophy, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.1.11: If she gets leave to ask about the Monastic Law, but she asks about the discourses or philosophy, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.1.12: If she gets leave to ask about philosophy, but she asks about the discourses or the Monastic Law, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.2.1: If she has not asked permission, and she perceives that she has not, and she asks a question, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.2.2: If she has not asked permission, but she is unsure of it, and she asks a question, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.2.3: If she has not asked permission, but she perceives that she has, and she asks a question, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.2.4: If she has asked permission, but she perceives that she has not, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.2.5: If she has asked permission, but she is unsure if she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.2.6: If she has asked permission, and she perceives that she has, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.3.2: if she asks after getting permission;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.3.3: if she gets permission, but not in regard to a specific subject, and she then asks about any subject;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.3.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc95:2.3.6: The twelfth training rule is finished.
